message.content:
{"id": "116744", "title": "Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect", "description": "", "OB": "The dynamic text element's Content Type property does not have any effect on the displayed results.", "EB": "Regardless of whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report continues to display the same results. The expected behavior is as follows: 

- For Plain, the literal content (including tags) should be displayed.
- For Auto, content 1, 2, and 3 should appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
- For HTML, content 1 and 2 should appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 should appear as is with RTF tags. The attached report demonstrates this issue.", "SR": "I have a database field that contains three types of content:

1) HTML text within <html>...</html> tags.
2) HTML fragments not within <html> tags.
3) Text with RTF tags.

I am using a dynamic text element to display the contents of this field."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '116744', 'title': 'Bug 116744Dynamic text content type has no effect', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': "The reportdisplays the same results whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Typeproperty to Auto, Plain, or HTML.Expected results:For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed.For Auto, I expect content 1, 2 and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTFtags.For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, andcontent 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.See attached report. ", 'SR': 'I have a db field with three types of content:1) HTML text within <html ...</html tag.2) HTML fragments not within <html tag3) Text with RTF tagsI use a dynamic text element to display the contents of this field. '}
